\def\PYG@toks#1+{\ifx\relax#1\empty\else%
    \PYG@tok{#1}\expandafter\PYG@toks\fi}
\def\PYG@do#1{\PYG@bc{\PYG@tc{\PYG@ul{%
    \PYG@it{\PYG@bf{\PYG@ff{#1}}}}}}}

\begin{document}

\tableofcontents
\phantomsection\label{README::doc}


Contents:


\chapter{1. QUICK START}
\label{README:quick-start}\label{README:welcome-to-modeller-script-s-documentation}

\chapter{1.1. Requirements}
\label{README:requirements}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
On IENA :

\end{itemize}

module add modeller/9.11
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Otherwise add the following expression in your bashrc :

\end{itemize}

export PYTHONPATH=/usr/lib/modeller9.11/modlib:/usr/lib/modeller9.11/lib/x86\_64-intel8/python2.5:\$PYTHONPATH
export LD\_LIBRARY\_PATH=/usr/lib/modeller9.11/lib/x86\_64-intel8:\$LD\_LIBRARY\_PATH

And :
source .bashrc


\chapter{1.2. Run}
\label{README:run}
To get the description of script options :

modeller\_script.py -h
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
First case: one alignment (template + model) + pdb (template)

\end{itemize}

modeller\_script.py  -i alignment.pir  -p structure.pdb
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Second case: one multifasta (template + model) + pdb (template) + alignment with clustalo

\end{itemize}

modeller\_script.py  -f sequences.fasta  -p structure.pdb  -a clustalo -g path/to/clustalo/
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Third case: modelize with several template and set 3 hetero atom from only one of these structures:

\end{itemize}

modeller\_script.py   -f sequences.fasta   -p structure1.pdb structure2.pdb -ht 3 -hm Model\_name Structure1\_name


\chapter{Indices and tables}
\label{README:indices-and-tables}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\emph{genindex}

\item {}

\item {} 
\emph{search}

\end{itemize}
